TopicTitle: The new module placement angle thingy

Articles.Content:
I don't know what they did to it but its bad. There used to be a logical pivot inheritance between modules placed on weird angles (shift wasdqe) but now I cant figure out how it works at all, makes building things really tedious. Now you cant even get things to even angles sometimes and where the original rotation comes from is beyond me. Its not like the old system was great, I've mumbled quite a few curse words because of it, but at least it was workable. plz fix.

Edited January 3, 2015 by hazarada
Shift+WASDQE still works as before. With R you can change rotation mode. That's new. Or you use the new gizmos.
I've noticed that if you use the new gizmos to rotate something and then you un-place a part and put it back, it screws up the rotation.
Also try pressing F to change between absolute and part-relative modes

Also try pressing F to change between absolute and part-relative modes

VHAT? Vhat is zis?

I didn't know about that! Must try.

Also, spacebar will reset your rotation of the root part (The selected one) which may solve your problem.

You could also go into no-angle-snap mode with C and fine-tune your rotation/translation (Also, it doesn't awkwardly snap to a position you didn't want in this mode.)
